page.title: 01Summary Of The Area.
page.content: This is mainly an area of enclosed fields between Newport,the principal town in the island, to the south and the coastal towns of Cowes and East Cowes to the north with Parkhurst Forest to the west. There is cosiderable ribbon development along the roads from Newport.The principal development is the three island prisons and associated staff housing in the southwest corner of the area. Here too is ST.Mary's Hospital complex and The Isle Of Wight Colllege Of Arts And Technology. The River Medina, rising in the south of the island, flows to Newport and continues through the area as a navigable waterway to Cowes harbour.Considerable use is made of the river for recreational purposes and too the track of the old railway line that ran alongside. {
